report_title: Coffee and Snack Shops Industry Report
executive_summary: Over the past five years, the Coffee and Snack Shops industry experienced a positive trend with revenues soaring at an annualized rate of 4.7% to $70.4 billion. This impressive growth, outpacing most segments of the food service sector, primarily stemmed from increased consumer spending on coffee and snacks before the COVID-19 pandemic. The industry has grown significantly in recent years, thanks largely to dynamic consumer behavior and trend-based evolution...

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Health-Conscious Snacking Steers Coffee Shop Offerings
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: An increasing number of consumers are becoming health-conscious, which has prompted a change in the kinds of snacks coffee shops offer. There's been a high demand for vegan, gluten-free, and low-sugar snack options...

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Swings in Global Coffee Prices Stem from Supply-Demand Dynamics and Environmental Factors
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The global coffee market is dealing with an imbalance between supply and demand. Although consumption is rising, production struggles to keep pace. This disparity is straining the coffee market and contributing to drastic price increases...

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Digitalization and Mobile Tech Drive Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Technology advancements, including mobile ordering apps and contactless payment options, have significantly impacted coffee and snack shops, streamlining operations and improving customer service...

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Premium Coffee Offerings and Consumer Spending Habits Shape the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Coffee and snack shops, specifically independent outlets, are undergoing a shift towards higher-quality offerings termed "third-wave coffee." This movement views coffee as an artisan product, like craft beer and wine, venturing beyond its traditional role as a working-day fuel...

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Technology Integration and Sustainability Will Enhance Customer Experience
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The outlook period will see a further technological fusion to enhance the customer experience in coffee and snack shops. This would range from high-speed wireless internet connections to mobile order-and-pay apps, AI-driven customer service, and perhaps even robotics...

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Coffee Shops Bank on Menu Diversification and Budget Meals for Future Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumer spending behaviors drive coffee and snack shops as an increasing number of patrons look for affordably priced, quick, and satisfying eats. This trend has accelerated since customers' disposable incomes became more flexible...

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Global Expansion Will Influence Industry Outlook
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Industry competition is predicted to intensify over the next five years. This is due to anticipated significant price-based competition and an increased focus on the regular introduction of new products...

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Growing Demand Will Continue to Drive Industry Outlook
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite increased automation in food preparation, growing demand is expected to push wages and employment higher for coffee and snack shops. However, part-time and seasonal jobs will likely remain common as businesses strive to control labor costs...

industry_definition: This industry comprises operators that prepare or serve specialty snacks and nonalcoholic beverages including ice cream, frozen yogurt, cookies,

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - increasing

key_trends: Low start-up costs result in a highly fragmented industry. New competitors can easily join via franchising, making the marketplace fiercely competitive.

Specialty coffee shops are cutting price wars by curating unique coffee blends. They utilize distinct roasting techniques and source beans from specific regions. Additionally, these outlets are tailoring their aesthetics and themes to attract more clients.
Coffee shops face bean-sourcing issues due to weather
Artisan coffee's rise is curbing competition from fast food chains
Small coffee shops face market entry challenges due to dominant national chains
Small coffee and snack shops face steep costs
Coffee and snack shops must obey food preparation and labor rules
Health concerns may deter coffee and snack shop visits
Rising competition and fluctuating costs impact profit
Coffee shop owners must manage unpredictable food and coffee costs
Coffee shops proliferate in populous, high-income states like California and New York
Dunkin' Donuts reigns supreme in New England

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE US FOOD AND DRUG ADMINISTRATION (FDA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The FDA's Model Food Code which is a best-practice guide to food handling and presentation, applies to this industry and is updated annually.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is in a mature life cycle stage.
The industry has a high level of revenue volatility.
There is no industry assistance, which is steady.
The competition level is high and increasing.

basis_points.basis_title: Low start-up costs result in a highly fragmented industry
basis_points.basis_description: Low start-up costs result in a highly fragmented industry. New competitors can easily join via franchising, making the marketplace fiercely competitive.

basis_points.basis_title: Specialty coffee shops are cutting price wars
basis_points.basis_description: Specialty coffee shops are cutting price wars by curating unique coffee blends. They utilize distinct roasting techniques and source beans from specific regions.

basis_points.basis_title: Coffee shops are tailoring their aesthetics and themes
basis_points.basis_description: Additionally, these outlets are tailoring their aesthetics and themes to attract more clients.

concentration_points.concentration_title: More than half of the industry is small-business shops
concentration_points.concentration_description: More than half of the industry is small-business shops. There is also a small number of large chains and franchised shops.
Starbucks, given its considerable market power, determines industry trends.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Dunkin' Donuts has substantial market power
concentration_points.concentration_description: Dunkin' Donuts' staggering number of franchised locations gives it substantial market power and creates a formidable barrier for nonfranchise players.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Major industry shops increased acquisition activity
concentration_points.concentration_description: Major industry shops increased acquisition activity. Many shops rely on the benefits of scale, and therefore, have begun to undergo consolidation to keep operating costs low and remain competitive.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Fluctuating Food Costs and Rising Coffee Prices Disrupt Profitability
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Shop owners face challenges as they often can't pass rising costs onto consumers. Hence, they must strategically manage their menus and portion sizes for the price hikes. This adaptability and balance in managing expenses boost profitability against cost variations.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Rising Labor Costs Affect the Coffee and Snack Shops Industry
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Despite the increased adoption of technology, labor costs in the industry have increased. This is due to the significant expense of food prep, cooking, serving, and clean-up. In addition to wages, the labor costs include benefits such as health insurance, workers' compensation, and unemployment insurance.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Size, Competition, Product Variety and High Input Costs Shape Industry Demand
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The industry is primarily characterized by fierce competition, which limits businesses' ability to generate substantial profits. This market is saturated with small, independent shops and larger chains like Starbucks. Multinational companies have the upper hand with economies of scale allowing them to achieve high profits.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry relies heavily on labor because of the need for personal, face-to-face service and labor input in all areas of operation. This includes personnel for order taking, serving, food and beverage preparation, acceptance of deliveries, cleaning and management.

volatility_points.volatility_title: HIGH-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS AND THE PROGRESS OF THE US ECONOMY SUSTAINED STEADY GROWTH
volatility_points.volatility_description: Volatility was low during most of the period as consumers continued and furthered regular spending habits amid a steadily growing economy. Because of the substantial decline in 2020, the industry has experienced higher volatility.

volatility_points.volatility_title: A RANGE OF FOOD TYPES SUITS CONSUMERS' CHANGING TASTES AND NEEDS
volatility_points.volatility_description: The fact that specific product segments like coffee shops and frozen yogurt have experienced steady growth has helped to maintain the industry's level of volatility. The vast product variety has responded to changes in consumer tastes and preferences.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Many shops have introduced electronic menus, through which customers scan a QR code to obtain the menu. Next, customers can order online to avoid wait time at the store. The technology helps coffee shops to better cater to time-strap customers.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Customization Helps Coffee Shops to Up-Sell
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Coffee shops have enabled customers to customize their choices, including ice and sugar levels. The introduction of additional toppings like cookie crumbles and milk types like oat milk, soy milk or nonfat milk comes at a price premium, boosting sales per drink.

FAQs.question: Many operators take to social media for their advertising needs. Does your company leverage social media platforms like Facebook or Twitter to inform and attract new customers?
How do review sites, such as Yelp and Google Reviews, impact sales?
FAQs.answer: Yelp and Google Reviews tend to have a larger impact on smaller operations that do not have a well established national brand. These smaller operators rely on reviews to establish their local brand.

FAQs.question: Is your company located in high-traffic areas to increase visibility?
FAQs.answer: Establishments located in high-traffic areas tend to be more successful in the long run due to higher foot-traffic.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities to expand your market share?
FAQs.answer: As the industry becomes more concentrated, operators with enough capital to make acquisitions and expand market share will do well. The ability to acquire smaller operators helps establish economies of scale.

FAQs.question: Does your establishment offer complimentary Wi-Fi to customers?
FAQs.answer: Establishments that offer free Wi-Fi to customers are able to attract clients looking to get out of the house to study, work or get personal computer work done.

FAQs.question: Does your company leverage mobile ordering applications to streamline the booking process?
FAQs.answer: Most larger industry operators offer mobile ordering through company based apps to help consumers skip the line and pay on their phone. Smaller operators typically do not have the economies of scale to make mobile ordering beneficial.

FAQs.question: Is your company subject to any franchising laws?
FAQs.answer: Establishments that function as franchises of major players such as Dunkin' Donuts or Starbucks are subject to franchise laws. There are both federal and state laws governing franchising, which vary from state to state.

FAQs.question: Is your company compliant with the varying labor regulations across states?
FAQs.answer: As most establishments are small local stores or franchises, franchisees or store owners typically only need to concern themselves with labor laws in the state that they function.

FAQs.question: How does your company's inventory turnover rate compare to your major competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Companies that are located in high-traffic areas tend to have a higher inventory turn over due to their <UNKNOWN>

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Larger companies tend to have higher profit margins due to their economies of scale; however, operators that offer high-end specialty products will also see higher profit margins.

FAQs.question: Are you part of a national chain? How can you compete with larger chains that have economies of scale and scope?
FAQs.answer: Franchising in the United States and abroad is now a significant component of this industry and can provide significant support to owners.

FAQs.question: Is your brand well-established? How can you improve your image in your local area?
FAQs.answer: Having a clear market position against competitors in the limited-service industry and other food service operators is a necessity.

FAQs.question: Do you engage in extensive market research? How do you anticipate and react to consumer trends?
FAQs.answer: Companies need to monitor market and consumer needs, wants and desires, particularly in relation to demand for healthy foods.

FAQs.question: How has rising health-consciousness influenced demand for your shops? How are your new offerings faring with consumers?
FAQs.answer: Despite long-term, aggregate declines in healthy eating, consumers are more aware of health issues associated with fatty foods and are increasingly going out of their way to avoid them.

FAQs.question: How do you monitor trends in coffee consumption? How can you better cater to changing consumer demands?
FAQs.answer: Coffee shops account for a large portion of industry revenue and establishments, and most other industry establishments also serve coffee. When coffee consumption increases, coffee shops and other snack shops experience revenue growth.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor changes in consumer spending? Do you find that consumers spend more in your establishment when consumer spending rises?
FAQs.answer: Factors that influence consumer spending also affect the industry. During periods of low economic growth, spikes in unemployment lead to consumption declines. However, when consumer spending is high, consumers are more likely to spend money at snack and coffee shops.
